title: A bit on the draconian side, arentcha...
content:
So I was going to add a post to this   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/36321.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053356/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/36321.html)   
thread\*, but it was "timed out". I thought there had to be a month of inactivity on a General Discussion thread (which is still too little, as far as I'm concerned), but this hadn't even been three weeks. What's the deal with such draconian measures to _prevent_ discussion?...   
   
\* Specifically, I was going to ask Nathan where the pitchurz were.   
   
hhp
author: hrant

comments.content:
\> I guess living in the U.S. ....   
   
That and coming from Beirut, I guess... Lethal combination.   
   
hhp
Yeah, I was gonna post about the pitchurz. I'll have 'em next week. Sorry 'bout the delay.

Nonono Hrant, I really don't think anyone is _preventing_  
discussions (what would be the point?)! The archiving   
is an automated feature, and archives the 60 or what   
oldest threads when a certain number of "live" threads   
is reached. I've had the same problem in the Type   
Identification Board: due to its very heavy traffic,   
some threads have a life span of less than two weeks!

Geez you can be paranoid sometimes (I guess living in   
the U.S. of CIA & FBI does that to you...) ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053356im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)
